name: anifp
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: sylibr(wa(w0, w1), wif(w2, w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, w1), wif(w2, w0, w1))
-| wi(wa(w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))
-| wb(wif(w2, w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, w1), wif(w2, w0, w1))
-| wi(wa(w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))
-| wb(wif(w2, w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))

stmt.origin: anim12i(w0, w1, wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))
-| wi(w0, wo(wn(w2), w0))
-| wi(w1, wo(w2, w1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(w0, w1), wif(w2, w0, w1))
-| wb(wif(w2, w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))
-| wi(w0, wo(wn(w2), w0))
-| wi(w1, wo(w2, w1))

|- wi(wa(w0, w1), wif(w2, w0, w1))
-| wb(wif(w2, w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))
-| wi(w1, wo(w2, w1))

|- wi(wa(w0, w1), wif(w2, w0, w1))
-| wb(wif(w2, w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))

body.origin: |- wb(wif(w2, w0, w1), wa(wo(wn(w2), w0), wo(w2, w1)))

comment: The conditional operator is implied by the conjunction of its possible outputs. Dual statement of ~ ifpor . (Contributed by BJ, 30-Sep-2019.)
